text: A small gossip test fix for code that was recently merged: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3373/>, just 8 lines, very easy review.
done <@U0ZJZBJLF>
Thanks a lot
You up for a bigger challenge perhaps? :wink:
I +2ed the gossip learning one too (its been baked long enough and has gone reviews ).. can <@U1HFNJB50> redo his +1 which got wiped out ?
er.., I was hoping to get some stuff done
:slightly_smiling_face:
which one were you thinking of ?
That one
Gossip learning
Thanks a lot
Its blocking the multi chan work
yes
sure thing
By the way, the difference between the last change set and the one before that is trivial l. I merely resolved a merge conflict
Thanks <@U0PB67X4K> and <@U0ULK2JPP> for the reviews.  Merge conflicts have been resolved in <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3299> and it is ready for +2s again.
if anyone's around, please have a look at <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3381/>  as well
<@U0PB67X4K> looking
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3365/> seems ignored :slightly_smiling_face: and is pure non-functional refactoring and code removal
there is one single line that requires some understanding of pbft
so it is safe to review :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U0Y14MWA2>:  oops - I did look at it.  Will +2 when back home
thks
<@U0PB67X4K> looks good… did have couple of suggestions though. Let me know what you think ?

A couple of more commits, appreciate any +1s and +2s:
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2841/> - Use mutual TLS and bind TLS cert to enrollment cert in gossip comm layer 
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3263/> - A very easy one (+5, -5 lines) regarding gossip Probe method
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3179/> - Changes to JoinChannel related API, needed for multi-channel support, 21 lines total

<@U0ULK2JPP>  - I commented on your suggestion.  I fixed the comments for the exported methods and added a function to return the server cert per <@U0ZJZBJLF> .   On your other suggestion, I did not do it yet but it does seem like a good idea.  I had noticed that the ordering package did not appear to spin off the server in a separate go routine (as it likely does not need to), but if they are ok with that approach, I can make the change

<@U0PB67X4K> but you with your current API you always can do this:

```
go func() {
   err := grpcServer.Start()
   notifier <- err
}()
```
<@U1HFNJB50>  - agreed
<@U0PB67X4K> right, in the orderer case (“I’ve done everything and now to serve and block”) we do not want to spin off a goroutine…. better write to the common denom as you have
exposing that  “spin off and get notified “ pattern would serve to suggest that loosely coupling design to users of your server… but we can always do that later

I commented on the "force goroutine creation" suggestion before seeing the discussion here. (I'm clearly against it FWIW, sorry Murali :white_frowning_face:) The loose coupling suggestion can be added as a comment to the method as is the case here: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/gitweb?p=fabric.git;a=blob;f=orderer/multichain/chainsupport.go;h=10dec72e98912bc6a067e55a18b7fb14bae23354;hb=refs/heads/master#l50>
This changeset should be fairly safe and completes the "create multiple chains in Kafka" workflow: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/3361>

<@U0XQ35CDD> note that to Stop(), one *has* to `gServer.server.Serve(gServer.listener)` in a goroutine somehow…. so if ever you want to call “Stop()” in the orderer, you have to spin it off. It kinda felt that’s going to be a general pattern in which case why not enforce it right upfront ?
but clearly arguable either way and ok with it :slightly_smiling_face:
This one should be OK to merge as well: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3253/>
<@U0PB67X4K> noticed Artems comment on simplifying too late … submitted and tried to revert in case you wanted to do that change in this change but gerrit didn’t take it… its in now
<@U0XQ35CDD> it does look ok, but perhaps I better stay off gerritt a bit :wink:
